comments.value:
We are now getting close to the public launch of the Games Maker programme, which means we need to make a few changes to the website:

1. Enable the links to the application form and portal - these are supposed to go top of the right hand column, above 'When to apply'. The original McCann creative should indicate these button and the wording. 

2. The link to the application form needs to take users on a particular journey - they should be taken first to the page called 'Get ready to apply' (this page needs some additional modification - see below) http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/get-ready-to-apply.php From there they should be linked through to the ATOS application form when they check the box and hit 'Apply now'. NB the user is currently taken through to the accessible application form, which is wrong - it should be the ATOS form

3. Accessible form - we are trying to decide where this will live from 15 Sept onwards - I will let you know. We will need to remove the field which requires a code at the top of the page, since this won't apply to general public users.

4. The 'app' files (Flash and html) need to be updated because at the end of the app users will be able to 'apply now' instead of being told to come back later. McCann will be resupplying these by the end of the week.

5. 'Get ready to apply page' - we need to add in a video player at the top of this page, but we won't get the actual player until very close to launch. The template meanwhile needs updating to be able to acommodate a standard blog-size player. 

6. We also want to add in video players to a number of pages - I will advise which these are, but it may require some template modification.

Re: timings, we are going live on Weds, 15 September. At the moment the business owner wants this all to go live at midnight on Wednesday morning - is this possible?

Happy to discuss the above as I realise there is a lot here....

Many thanks!

3.

A couple more thoughts:

Will Chartbeat still be monitoring the site so we can keep an eye on traffic?

Do all the pages have Google Analytics code in them e.g. landing page, 'get ready to apply' page?

We will also want to replace the Tickets promo which is an include throughout the site with a Games Maker promo - I think you would need to do something magic to render the link as live text

Hi Morag,

Just going over these now and will either reply by email or give you a call re. any questions in the next day or so.

Jamie
Thank you!
Get ready to apply page - the buttons at the bottom of the page 'Back to Volunteering home' and 'Other volunteering opps' need to be amended to link to the right pages
Get ready to apply page - checkbox at bottom needs a message if you click 'Submit' without checking the box

- completed 'checkbox at bottom/message'
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/get-ready-to-apply.php

Still other tasks to complete below.
Total for work on this (not covered by sepearte individual tickets) in the run up to launch, including out of hours support on night and morning of launch.

subject: Games Maker public launch, 15 September
description:
We are now getting close to the public launch of the Games Maker programme, which means we need to make a few changes to the website:

1. Enable the links to the application form and portal - these are supposed to go top of the right hand column, above 'When to apply'. The original McCann creative should indicate these button and the wording. 

2. The link to the application form needs to take users on a particular journey - they should be taken first to the page called 'Get ready to apply' (this page needs some additional modification - see below) http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/get-ready-to-apply.php From there they should be linked through to the ATOS application form when they check the box and hit 'Apply now'. NB the user is currently taken through to the accessible application form, which is wrong - it should be the ATOS form

3. Accessible form - we are trying to decide where this will live from 15 Sept onwards - I will let you know. We will need to remove the field which requires a code at the top of the page, since this won't apply to general public users.

4. The 'app' files (Flash and html) need to be updated because at the end of the app users will be able to 'apply now' instead of being told to come back later. McCann will be resupplying these by the end of the week.

5. 'Get ready to apply page' - we need to add in a video player at the top of this page, but we won't get the actual player until very close to launch. The template meanwhile needs updating to be able to acommodate a standard blog-size player. 

6. We also want to add in video players to a number of pages - I will advise which these are, but it may require some template modification.

Re: timings, we are going live on Weds, 15 September. At the moment the business owner wants this all to go live at midnight on Wednesday morning - is this possible?

Happy to discuss the above as I realise there is a lot here....

Many thanks!

3.

Hi, as discussed:

This page doesn't seem to be coming up in the navigation bar in the Get involved section, and also the short URL has stopped working since I republished (london2012.com/technologyinternships).

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/locog-technology-internship-programme/locog-technology-internship-programme.php

I need to get this sorted asap, please! Thank you!
Kathryn

Hi Kathryn, I'm looking at this now.
Firstly, I'll get the short link working, then discuss the navigation bar issue with you.

Hi,

This is sorted now, thanks!

Kathryn
do you mean the short link is sorted? or the whole issue is sorted?
The entire issue, thanks.

Fixed the short url.
Currently discussing case-sensitivity w. jamie.
Part of their issue was that the page had been renamed from technology-...blah.php to index.php - meaning that the shorturl didn't work any more.

comments.value:
1) Main 'jump off' page to ATOS form (new registrations)
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/get-ready-to-apply.php

Setup a redirect (commented out) so that in case of a problem with ATOS site the http://www.london2012.com/temporary/pages/html/page-unavailable.html page will be served instead.

2) Returning user 'jump off' / redirect page to ATOS form (returning user)

Create an intermediate page in the CMS whose sole purpose is to redirect users to the ATOS site ie.
Link in page -> intermediate redirect page -> ATOS site (returning user)

The uses will be unaware of this page, it is simply a redirect but in case of an issue we can divert users to the holding page.

Let Russ know what changes have been made

Jamie

Done..

t's actually a change to the htaccess file, I have created an ready-to-go amended copy on the server (path below) and a diff of that file and the current .htaccess file at the end of this email.
/var/www/html/new.london2012.com/htaccess-volunteersite-overloaded.txt 

It should be as simple as simple as making a backup of the current file and then replacing the current .htacecss file with this pre-ammened copy.

cp /var/www/html/new.london2012.com/.htaccess var/www/html/new.london2012.com/backup_htaccess_13_10_2010
cp /var/www/html/new.london2012.com/htaccess-volunteersite-overloaded.txt var/www/html/new.london2012.com/.htaccess

However the live .htaccess file may change between now and Wednesday and so it would be wise to check the timestamps on the live .htaccess fiel / do a diff before running the above to see if anything else has changed.

subject: pre-setup fallover redirects / backup .htaccess file for Vounteering links
description:
1) Main 'jump off' page to ATOS form (new registrations)
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/get-ready-to-apply.php

Setup a redirect (commented out) so that in case of a problem with ATOS site the http://www.london2012.com/temporary/pages/html/page-unavailable.html page will be served instead.

2) Returning user 'jump off' / redirect page to ATOS form (returning user)

Create an intermediate page in the CMS whose sole purpose is to redirect users to the ATOS site ie.
Link in page -> intermediate redirect page -> ATOS site (returning user)

The uses will be unaware of this page, it is simply a redirect but in case of an issue we can divert users to the holding page.

Let Russ know what changes have been made

Jamie

comments.value: Just to confirm: this is the link which should be used to take people through to the portal from the GM site: https://volunteer.london2012.com/ESIREG/

Also setup an intermediate jump-off page this is the page (it's actually just a redirect internally) you should link in the CMS to direct users back to the ATOS form (in case of an issue we can change this page and redirect users elsewhere).

Basically it's an intermediate 'exit' page/redirect.

ATOS Returning User Redirect
/get-involved/volunteer/atos-returning-user-redirect.php

comments.value:
Dear Colleagues

In order to ring fence the Volunteer Portal Launch on the 15th  September  , LOCOG Technology will be enforcing  a change freeze from 10th  September till 17th  September inclusive .

During this time changes can be submitted and progressed however any that are due for completion during this time that have a direct impact on our day to day core systems  will have to be rescheduled. All other changes can progress as normal.

Please pass this to anyone with your organisation that it may have relevance to.


Kind Regards,

Jonathan Davis
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
Mobile: 07760769400
DDI:+44  (0  302 0120 104
Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001
www.london2012.com

[cid:image001.gif@01CB502E.CCFF4430]

subject: Volunteer Portal Launch - Change Freeze
latest_recipients: David.Veloz@bt.com Andrew.s.parker@bt.com mike@stamen.com John.Aitchison@visitbritain.org ITS@london2012.com Liz.Goulding@london2012.com Morag.Reavley@london2012.com ah.support@bt.com support@cimex.com info@stamen.com info@deltatre.com jamie@kitsite.com s

Subject: FW: Volunteer Routine/Procedures

Morag

Do you have the Sorry page (HTML and IMAGES) - or will Jamie have this?

The reason I ask is that the sorry page and all the assets will have to be served from Akamai so they'll all have to reside there too.





Jagdeep Singh Bhambra
Service Engineering Manager
Internet Technology Services
Technology
From: Russ Ede
Sent: 08 September 2010 16:16
To: Jagdeep Bhambra
Cc: Huw Williams
Subject: FW: Volunteer Routine/Procedures

Jag

Thanks for your help with this.

Here are the ESI support arrangements from the specialist volunteering launch - Atos have not updated these as far as I know.

The landing page on the BT infrastructure that volunteers are pointed to from the email that they are sent is:

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/specialist-group-application/index.php

If we need to prevent volunteers from going to the ATOS site this needs to be replaced by this sorry page:

http://www.london2012.com/temporary/pages/html/page-unavailable.html

Is there any way to test this before next Wednesday?



I also note that the landing page here is specific to the specialist groups - I will find out from Morag what the landing page for  general volunteering will be.

I cannot find the sorry page for the entire 2012 site in case of a major issue - will ask Morag about that too.



Thanks once again.

Russ

Russ Ede
Internet Technology Services

From: Blandine Lassau
Sent: 21 July 2010 11:24

Cc: Peter Howgego; Annabel Gunnell
Subject: RE: Volunteer Routine/Procedures

Phil, Thanks for that.
As promised, attached the ESI detailed support procedure and the agreed definition of IT severity levels shared for IT issues the IT service desk is dealing with(i.e. includes obviously the GMS system suite).
Regards
Blandine

Cc: Peter Howgego; Annabel Gunnell
Subject: Volunteer Routine/Procedures

Please be aware that this is a rough draft and has had no sign-off as yet.  Jean is reviewing today.  I'd be grateful for your comments/observations/highlighting any omissions by close of play tomorrow.

Thanks for this morning's meeting which I found very useful

comments.value:
Hi, I am having issues posting pictures in CMS. When I hit publish the save pop-up comes up for a few seconds and then disappears. But it doesn't save or publish!

Thanks,
Kathryn

[cid:image001.png@01CB4A8A.C6639B70]

Hi Kathryn,

Sorry we're taken a while to get back to you on this one, we have found the issue but still working on a fix.

In the mean time if you navigate to the photo folder (in the Browse/Folder view in the CMS) and then to the relevant date folder within it, you can create a page like you would nay other page in the CMS (ie. don't use the dedicated photo page editor). ie. click the folder then click the plus and select 'Photo page' as the page type.

We should have this fixed soon but just in case you we're in a rush to get the photo up. 

Jamie

Great, I’ll do that. Thanks!

Kathryn

The photo page creator/editor should be working now.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/Photo%20pages

Jamie
Brilliant, thanks!
Jamie, you've put 0 billable days on this. I am assuming that you want this marked as not billable. Change the billing to "billable" if that's wrong.

Can we make this a high priority?  Along with some instructions on how to create them (I don't know how)!
Michael, have anchors in fact ever worked? And have you got any sense of what's involved in getting them working?
It looks to me as if the bundle including this must have gone live at some point in the last month. You use the "Anchor" tool from the page editor's "Insert" menu.

Agreed that this work is not billable. Morag, I have just tested this and it does appear to work. Would you mind giving it a go? Once you have named and anchor, you just have to enter the name preceded by a '#' in the link chooser.
Marking as solved.

Sorry, Danny. I should have replied to this sooner.

I have tried this but it doesn’t work still.

Please see this page where I have done as you said: http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/roles-and-venues/roles/ceremonies-and-culture.php#victoryceremonies

Can you advise what we should do?

Hi Morag. We may have to run through this together or quite possibly it's an issue with your browser. I have just inserted an anchor tag and everything seems to be working OK.

See http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/get-involved/volunteer/games-maker-roles-and-venues/roles-and-functional-areas/ceremonies-and-culture.php

And http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/volunteer/games-maker-roles-and-venues/roles-and-functional-areas/ceremonies-and-culture.php#victoryceremonies

Perhaps we could go over it on the phone. When is good for you?
As this is now working in Firefox but apparently not in IE8, I am changing the title to "Anchor links in IE8" and setting to priority normal.
I have added a help page on anchor links: http://postcms.zendesk.com/entries/213549

Hi
The Cycling - Road page in the Sports section is showing three of the football stadiums as the venue. The page itself is not tagged in metadata with any venue as it's yet to be finalised. Is it possible to remove the venue information on this page for now?

In the metadata, I changed the Venue to "TBA", there are now no venues appearing. Please check and republish.

(there is of course no venue called TBA, but if you enter a non-existent venue, no venues will be displayed)

Uzma Khan New Media Assistant Communications Direct line: 020 3023 6927 Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7a 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com P Please consider the environment before printing this email From: Anthony Palmer Sent: 26 August 2010 14:40 To: Uzma Khan Cc: Simon Knowles; Paul Jennings Subject: FW: Aquatics cam This cam needs updating on the CMS - it's the Aquatics internal view. A From: Gareth Evans-McClave [mailto:gareth@site-eye.co.uk] Sent: 26 August 2010 14:29 To: Paul Jennings Cc: 'Tom Edwards'; 'Brad Williams'; 'Ed J Gaskell Cooper'; Anthony Palmer Subject: Aquatics cam Paul We have replaced camera 1 (aquatics fill) with camera 27 due to the failure of camera 1. If this camera is used on the website, the link should now be changed to: Thanks Gareth No virus found in this incoming message. Checked by AVG - www.avg.com Version: 9.0.851 / Virus Database: 271.1.1/3094 - Release Date: 08/25/10 19:34:00
This email and any attachments are for the attention of the addressee(s) only. It may also be confidential. Its unauthorised use and disclosure storage or copying is not permitted. Hi,

I would like to move this page

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/whos-who/index.php

to the subsection 'Becoming part of the Cultural Olympiad' (ie alongside Creative Programmers and What's Happening Now). But I am having issues trying to do this.

Thanks for your help,
Kathryn


Kathryn Gilbert
Content Assistant
Direct line: +44 (0)20 3 2012 304

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001
london2012.com


P Please consider the environment before printing this email

Hi Kathryn

The problem was that the page you were moving was an index page (with a filename of index.html) of which their can only be one per section.

* an index page is the page you get it you omit the filename, hence why you can only have one per section. ie. 
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/becoming-part-of-the-cultural-olympiad/

Anyway, I've renamed the filename for you to 'whos-who.php' and moved the page into the /becoming-part-of-the-cultural-olympiad/ section.
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/becoming-part-of-the-cultural-olympiad/whos-who.php

Hopefully that should have sorted it out..

Jamie

comments.value:
On all pages ... much like the attached.  Quote please?



Liz Goulding
New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

When you say all pages?

Anywhere, anytime, anyplace, or just on the Related Videos? or Related Photos as well or more?

It's a tricky one to quote on until we do it, but obviously you want / need some perimeters / idea of what it could cost !!

Maybe the best way to deal with pieces of work like this is us to estimate (say one day) so you have a rough idea, but if before that day has finished it looks like it's turing into more work than that we get back to you so you can decide if you want to progress. These small jobs where we may hit CSS or cross browser issues are often hardest pieces of work to give a tight fixed cost for, unless we just quote slightly higher to cover any contingency. 

Sorry Liz, slightly hijacked this ticket, let keep any further discussion (in this ticket) to the icons !!!

I meant related videos and related photos ... as the appear on the right hand side of the templates that carry them!

And i agree with the principle of a best guess (1 day) and then a follow up if there is going to be a significant (more than .5 day) deviation from the initial estimate!

Do you think 1 day for this one?

OK lets say one day and see if we can get it in under that ;-)

the .5 day deviation alert sounds perfect..
splendidum
